required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risankizumab Therapy Versus Placebo for Subjects With Psoriasis in the Russian Federation
clinical_study.official_title: Risankizumab Versus Placebo in a Randomized, Double Blind, Parallel Group Trial in Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis to Assess Safety and Efficacy After 16 Weeks of Treatment in the Russian Federation (IMMpress)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and efficacy of risankizumab compared to placebo in subjects with moderate to severe chronic plaque psoriasis in the Russian Federation.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with a 90% reduction from Baseline Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI 90) at Week 16
primary_outcome.description: The PASI score is an established measure of clinical efficacy for psoriasis medications.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with Static Physician Global Assessment (sPGA) score of clear or almost clear (0, 1) at Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The sPGA is based on the physician's assessment of the average thickness, erythema, and scaling of all psoriatic lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with a 75% reduction from Baseline Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI 75) at Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The PASI score is an established measure of clinical efficacy for psoriasis medications.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with a 100% reduction from Baseline Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI 100) at Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The PASI score is an established measure of clinical efficacy for psoriasis medications.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Achieving a Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) Score of 0 or 1 at Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The DLQI is a self-administered, ten-question questionnaire used to assess the effect of different skin diseases on a subject's quality of life, overall health, and disability status. Scores range from 0 (not relevant/not at all) to 3 (very much).

arm_group.description: Placebo for risankizumab by subcutaneous (SC) injection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A diagnosis of chronic plaque psoriasis (with or without psoriatic arthritis) for at least 6 months before the first administration of study drug.
- Moderate to severe chronic plaque psoriasis at both Screening and Baseline (Randomization) Visits
- Candidates for systemic therapy or phototherapy for psoriasis treatment as assessed by the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior therapy with an anti-interleukin (IL)-17 or anti-IL12/23p40 or anti-IL-23p19 inhibitor
- Concurrent therapy with a biologic and/or other systemic therapy

facility.name: GBUZ Clinical Dermatovenerology Dispensary of MoH of Krasnodar region /ID# 201713
SBHI KVD # 10 Clinic of Dermatology and venerology /ID# 200615

patient_data.ipd_description: AbbVie is committed to responsible data sharing regarding the clinical trials we sponsor. This includes access to anonymized, individual and trial-level data (analysis data sets), as well as other information (e.g., protocols and clinical study reports), as long as the trials are not part of an ongoing or planned regulatory submission. This includes requests for clinical trial data for unlicensed products and indications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data requests can be submitted at any time and the data will be accessible for 12 months, with possible extensions considered.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access to this clinical trial data can be requested by any qualified researchers who engage in rigorous, independent scientific research, and will be provided following review and approval of a research proposal and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and execution of a Data Sharing Agreement (DSA). For more information on the process, or to submit a request, visit the following link.
